Reviews.Title: Works very well
Reviews.Author: Gregory Coleman "Greg"
Reviews.Content: I have been using these Baluns for several weeks to connect to a 12v high resolution color underwater video camera through a 500' cat5e cable. Image is perfect and voltage drop isn't too bad(about 1/2v every 100 feet). Great buy at this price. (Make sure your source voltage is high enough to counter the voltage drop or you won't be able to power your camera)

Reviews.Title: Works great! - Even used two with one CAT5e Cable to give me 2 cameras in a single CAT5e drop.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Works great, picture is clear, no issues at all (My Max run is about 200')  I will be picking up 4 more very soon!I have 2 Cat5e lines running to one camera each (using one balun on each end), and two cameras on one Cat5e line using two balun's on each end.To get two cameras on a single CAT5e line:I had to do a bit of discovery when pinning them out to split one cat5 into two cameras, (I will provide some or of that info below) but for the one to one connections if you punch it down on both sides straight through (I used type B) they work great.  When I pinned them out I found the following:Cat5 Pin 1 - video (BNC Inside) +Cat5 Pin 2 - video (BNC Outside \ ground) -Cat5 Pin 3 - Audio (RCA Inside) +Cat5 Pin 4 - Power (Inside) +  <-- there are two power in and power out, only one is needed for a 12v camera.Cat5 Pin 5 - Power (Inside) +  <-- there are two power in and power out, only one is needed for a 12v camera.Cat5 Pin 6 - Audio (RCA Outside \ Ground) -Cat5 Pin 7 - Power (Outside \ Ground) -  <-- there are two power in and power out, only one is needed for a 12v camera.Cat5 Pin 8 - Power (Outside \ Ground) -  <-- there are two power in and power out, only one is needed for a 12v camera.To make two cameras work over one Cat5e for this setup I used only video and power, and used only 1 of the inside and out side power. (see my customer images for the physical diagrams.)I terminated two ends to the single CAt5e on each end of the cable, (4 ends total on the cable) then plugged two of the balun's into the cable giving me the ability to use two cameras over 1 wire.To do this I used the blue pair 1 and 2, the orange pair on 5 and 8, then repeated for the second camera with green on 1 and 2 and brown on 5 and 8.All around the product is better and less expensive than other Balun's have I have used.  They were easy to work with and despite their size I was able to fit two of them into 1 single gang box for my dual camera over 1 Cat5e cable setup.Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: VideoSecu CCTV Security Camera Video Audio balun...
Reviews.Author: Johnie lester
Reviews.Content: I purchased video baluns that look like these from another company at a much higher price ($35.00). I thought I try these at half the cost an after they arrived I found them to be in a different package and both were made in China, identical right down to the stickers. I have used these for at least 5 months now and the quality of video is great.Why pay more for the same product, I highly recommend these.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly!! 300 Ft
Reviews.Author: BillyETX
Reviews.Content: It is nice to know I can just pull Cat5 wires and have audio, video, and power ready.These things worked perfectly, it is the only way I'll ever set up CCTV again for the rest of my life. I ran one stretch of wire almost 300 feet through conduit to my gate at the beginning of my driveway to catch license plates.Checking the video coming in through this and coming in over the standard 60' cables with just Audio/power there seems to be less noise and interference going over Cat5. foolish to not use these!!!The only downside is the size of the unit with the BNC connection fastened to it. not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Time Saver!
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: I bought four of these and all four worked perfect.  What a time saver.  Much easier than dealing with BNC cables and connectors.

Reviews.Title: Short-term testing, works great!
Reviews.Author: DaveFromRI "Mr. Critical"
Reviews.Content: I saw a message from Amazon about clone rip-off's not marked as sold by VideoSecu, yet my order clearly indicates the seller accurately. Without any specific marking on the product (and Amazon pictures match exactly), I can only conclude that I recieved the correct product.Regardless, the one pair (sender/reciever) I recieved worked so well, I ordered another set (yet to arrive).The audio feed is unnessary as my camera's don't have audio, but I'm sure others can use it.Others have commented on the fact that the transmitter (camera side) has a fixed on-the-body BNC connector, but every current camera I've seen has a female BNC on a 4-8" wire. So, I don't see this as a problem, or if your camera has an on-body BNC connector, a short BNC cable plus a BNC-TO-BNC female adapter will cheaply solve the problem.I like this product!

Reviews.Title: Work Like Magic
Reviews.Author: Anarchy
Reviews.Content: These baluns work well with CAT5e to send power to an analog camera and receive the data (picture).  One is made for the DVR connection (BNC connection) and one for the camera connection  The power comes from a wall wart (plug into the wall).  It somehow pushes the power to the camera and sends the data back.  I don't know what the maximum distance is but I've got cameras 350 feet away from the DVR sending good pictures back.  They are an adapter for guys who want to use CAT5 instead of coaxial cable (RG59).  On the camera end they need to be in a water-proof box.  I use 4" PVC pipe for the camera and 4" PVC pipe caps for the wires.  Works great.

Reviews.Title: Installed this set.  Works great!
Reviews.Author: William H. Roberts "electronics nut"
Reviews.Content: I had wired my house during construction with 4 pair telephone cable, back when Ethernet was new and CAT 3 cable was expensive.  When I ordered this set I was not sure it would work on the old cable, but it did.  I am running a camera on this arrangement for about 50 feet.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: J. Brennan
Reviews.Content: Does every thing it was designed for. I have 6 others that were installed by my security guy. Plugs directly on the back of some CCTV cameras.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: BobL
Reviews.Content: What's not to like? Using CAT5 Cable is cheaper than Siamese Coax, and this unit carries the power and audio on the CAT5 too. I just tried it for the video signal, with the camera power  connected from the power supply direclty to the camera.I've used Coax in some runs for long distance buried in pipe too

Reviews.Title: Survelance
Reviews.Author: LukRain
Reviews.Content: Great Product... It works well for what I wanted to do..with my cameras , .. and  would certainly hope they last, at very long time.

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Chavez
Reviews.Content: I love these little devices. I install some cameras but only had space for CAT5E cabling. Installed around the property neat and tight and 1 cable feeds video/power/audio. Will be redoing my property with this set up.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great
Reviews.Author: DFR2923
Reviews.Content: Hooked up out of the box on a 150' run  and absolutely no problems worked great!  Will use these again!

Reviews.Title: Works as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Larry Howard
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised.  It sure made it easier and cheaper to run 5 Cat5 network cables over 100 feet as opposed to 5 video cables that long.  I'm not sure if the transceivers are water resistant for outdoor use so I protected those that are outside.  I liked them so much, when I put a video system up for my sister-in-law, I used these transceivers on all cable runs longer than 60 feet.  I'm probably going to get some more of these babies considering I have room for 8 more cameras on my security system.

Reviews.Title: Great product fast delivery
Reviews.Author: KennyP
Reviews.Content: I ordered a competing video balan which arrived DOA.  I got 5 of this balun and they all worked as expected.  The video quality is excellent over all of my Cat 5 runs (my longest is about 80 ft).  Easy to hook up.  Great price relative to others I saw.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Works well!
Reviews.Author: RyBan
Reviews.Content: Loved using these, the pigtails included on the balun make them easy to use and the power connectors make connecting them to the power supply a breeze. Had no issues with any of them.

Reviews.Title: Balums worked Perfect with Cat6 Cabling to provide a great picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Crezno
Reviews.Content: I bought 8 of these units to wire up my cameras at my property and they worked perfectly.  Prior, i had bought some 100 foot BNC/Power cables and i had some go bad and got tired of replacing them. They were cheaply made, but regardless, I wanted something better.These are Cat6 Compatible, which is what I used.  Many reviewers are stating they are getting 200 and 300 foot runs, and I just wanted to shed some light on how that may or may not be true in your case. There are many factors including Camera wattage, and cable wire gauges that will determine your overall max distance. I have done the research and tested it and I highly doubt you could get 1000 feet with a cat5 as its listed in the description.Cat6 has a wire gauge between 22-24. I used belkin high performance Cat6 on my install, which comes with 23 gauge wiring. The Balun uses 2 pairs of wiring for power, which is necessary to carry the power load across it.  In my case, a pair of 23 gauge wires is almost exactly the same size as a 20 gauge wire. (.0226" diameter wire doubled nets a .032" Diameter which is the spec of a 20 gauge wire).The reason the above is important is due to the fact that these cameras run on 12v. 12v requires a large wire to carry the current over long distances.  My cameras are CCD's and use 24 IR LEDS and are more power hungry than normal (4 watts each), which is why I opted for Cat6. To be exact, factoring in a reasonable 10% voltage drop, using the balum on a 1:1 ration (no modification to split the wire to run 2 cameras) with a 23 Gauge Cat6 cable will go a maximum of 180 Feet on a 4 Watt camera and only 90 Feet on a 4 Watt camera using only 1 pair of wires for power.  My longest runs are about 80 feet, which allows for no more than a 4.5% voltage drop, which is excellent for CCD cameras, which are touchy on voltage drops. The picture quality is night and day from my old cables.The reviewers that used Cat5 cables (Cat5 is typically between 24-26 gauge wiring), best case scenario (a 24 gauge Cat5e cable), these balums would only reach, about 142 Feet on a 4 Watt camera, and 71 Feet if you only use 1 pair of wires for power on a 4 Watt Camera and maintain no more than a 10% voltage drop. (It would be 70Feet/35Feet if you wanted no more than a 5% voltage drop).This is just a little more technical overview of the capabilities of the wire, and of course there are more factors such as wire quality, not just the gauge.  But it’s a general idea of why im sure some people have issues with the balums.  Just know that, you will be able to go 30% farther with the same quality with a Cat6, and know the limitations of splitting the cable to run more than 1 camera.Im not sure what Wattage other cameras pull, but for example, a 2 Watt camera, you could double all distance I wrote above. A 3 Watt camera you would multiply the distances by 1.5, etc… Or even the opposite way. An 8 watt camera you would divide all the distances by 2.

Reviews.Title: Works as promised...audio not tested yet.
Reviews.Author: Tommy_Boy
Reviews.Content: These work great, but haven't tested the audio yet. Picture quality is good using these and it's nice to use cat5 cable for audio, video and power. I've only tested these for a day so I cannot speak to the duration of these running 24/7/365 or the audio quality (not using audio at this time.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, No problems
Reviews.Author: Doitallbetter "Build it  better"
Reviews.Content: Each worked fine.  No problems.  Quality looking.  I liked the tasle on the receiving end to allow easy connections to my DVR.

Reviews.Title: No more RG59 cables!
Reviews.Author: CLTGUY
Reviews.Content: I am so glad we don't have to purchase anymore bulky cables, pulling cat5 is much cheaper and easier than RG59.  No longer needing to crimp the BNC ends is also a bonus.  Punching cat5 is very simple, reliable, and neat.

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: D. Tatum "IT_Guy"
Reviews.Content: Great baluns for the price. Ive ordered 6 pairs, and they all have worked flawlessly! They also support audio over Cat5 too!

Reviews.Title: Great working pair of baluns
Reviews.Author: Melly G
Reviews.Content: I have tried many CCTV baluns over CAT5 and I can honestly say this is one of the fewer ones that actually work and have yet to go out on me.Very easy to install and got it up and running in no time.

Reviews.Title: No issues yet
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: I have many of these installed for many customers' security cameras over the past few years. They install easy and they do the job. When my customers complain, then I will speak differently, but that has yet to happen.Simply in my opinion, it's a much better alternative to the thinly gauged prefabricated siamese cables you can buy on Amazon or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Some Issues
Reviews.Author: John D. "Break Maker"
Reviews.Content: While I have been able to make most of them work, they can can be very positional at times.  Not the greatest but they get the job done and allow you to use custom lengths of Cat 5 cable for CCTV runs

Reviews.Title: 50% failure rate
Reviews.Author: Diver
Reviews.Content: I was buying the ones with out the audio but cant seem to find them anymore.  Looked like the same brand as these.  I bought a bunch of these and have had a 50% failure rate.  Fortunately most did not work right out of the box.  Had one that failed after a month.  I put line testor on them to confirm they were bad.

Reviews.Title: Video secu balun no instructions
Reviews.Author: Kevin Adam
Reviews.Content: Bought 10 of these Baluns theres no instructions to tell what pin goes to what a can't find any online either to download from. realy need the instructions to install these baluns.

Reviews.Title: Haven't used yet
Reviews.Author: Philip Runfeldt
Reviews.Content: Haven't used yet, but will soon.  I had to pull some cat 5 through conduit so couldn't buy with ends.I gave product a 4 just because making up the ends can be tedious if you don't work on electronics much.I ended up just splicing in the wire to some end that handed wire molded in.It should work just fine and does say it will amplify the signal.  I will write again after I use them

Reviews.Title: Arrived open
Reviews.Author: CPT VIDEO
Reviews.Content: Fast shippment but it arrived open.  Not just outer bag  but the actual packaging.  Tested on short CAT 5 cable all seem to work.  Waiting on 200 foot cables to test.  Will report after Nov 6.
